tool.name: FeatureFinderMetabo
tool.description: Assembles metabolite features from centroided (LC-)MS data using the mass trace approach.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out && #if "out_chrom_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_chrom && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' #if "out_chrom_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_chrom 'out_chrom/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' #end if #if len(str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',')) == 0 | tee '$stdout' #end if
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' '$out' #if "out_chrom_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_chrom/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' '$out_chrom' #end if #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in
param.label: Centroided mzML file

section.name: common
section.title: Common parameters for all other subsections

param.name: noise_threshold_int
param.label: Intensity threshold below which peaks are regarded as noise

param.name: chrom_peak_snr
param.label: Minimum signal-to-noise a mass trace should have

param.name: chrom_fwhm
param.label: Expected chromatographic peak width (in seconds)

param.name: mass_error_ppm
param.label: Allowed mass deviation (in ppm)

param.name: reestimate_mt_sd
param.label: Enables dynamic re-estimation of m/z variance during mass trace collection stage

param.name: quant_method
param.label: Method of quantification for mass traces
param.help: For LC data 'area' is recommended, 'median' for direct injection data. 'max_height' simply uses the most intense peak in the trace

param.name: trace_termination_criterion
param.label: Termination criterion for the extension of mass traces
param.help: In 'outlier' mode, trace extension cancels if a predefined number of consecutive outliers are found (see trace_termination_outliers parameter). In 'sample_rate' mode, trace extension in both directions stops if ratio of found peaks versus visited spectra falls below the 'min_sample_rate' threshold

param.name: trace_termination_outliers
param.label: Mass trace extension in one direction cancels if this number of consecutive spectra with no detectable peaks is reached

param.name: min_sample_rate
param.label: Minimum fraction of scans along the mass trace that must contain a peak

param.name: min_trace_length
param.label: Minimum expected length of a mass trace (in seconds)

param.name: max_trace_length
param.label: Maximum expected length of a mass trace (in seconds)
param.help: Set to a negative value to disable maximal length check during mass trace detection

section.name: epd
section.title: Elution Profile Detection (to separate isobaric Mass Traces by elution time)

param.name: enabled
param.label: Enable splitting of isobaric mass traces by chromatographic peak detection

param.name: width_filtering
param.label: Enable filtering of unlikely peak widths
param.help: The fixed setting filters out mass traces outside the [min_fwhm, max_fwhm] interval (set parameters accordingly!). The auto setting filters with the 5 and 95% quantiles of the peak width distribution

param.name: min_fwhm
param.label: Minimum full-width-at-half-maximum of chromatographic peaks (in seconds)
param.help: Ignored if parameter width_filtering is off or auto

param.name: max_fwhm
param.label: Maximum full-width-at-half-maximum of chromatographic peaks (in seconds)
param.help: Ignored if parameter width_filtering is off or auto

param.name: masstrace_snr_filtering
param.label: Apply post-filtering by signal-to-noise ratio after smoothing

section.name: ffm
section.title: FeatureFinder parameters (assembling mass traces to charged features)

param.name: local_rt_range
param.label: RT range where to look for coeluting mass traces

param.name: local_mz_range
param.label: MZ range where to look for isotopic mass traces

param.name: charge_lower_bound
param.label: Lowest charge state to conside

param.name: charge_upper_bound
param.label: Highest charge state to conside

param.name: report_summed_ints
param.label: Set to true for a feature intensity summed up over all traces rather than using monoisotopic trace intensity alone

param.name: enable_RT_filtering
param.label: Require sufficient overlap in RT while assembling mass traces

param.name: isotope_filtering_model
param.label: Remove/score candidate assemblies based on isotope intensities
param.help: SVM isotope models for metabolites were trained with either 2% or 5% RMS error. For peptides, an averagine cosine scoring is used. Select the appropriate noise model according to the quality of measurement or MS device

param.name: mz_scoring_13C
param.label: Use the 13C isotope peak position (~1.003355 Da) as the expected shift in m/z for isotope mass traces (highly recommended for lipidomics!)
param.help: Disable for general metabolites (as described in Kenar et al. 2014, MCP.)

param.name: use_smoothed_intensities
param.label: Use LOWESS intensities instead of raw intensities

param.name: report_convex_hulls
param.label: Augment each reported feature with the convex hull of the underlying mass traces (increases featureXML file size considerably)

param.name: remove_single_traces
param.label: Remove unassembled traces (single traces)

param.name: mz_scoring_by_elements
param.label: Use the m/z range of the assumed elements to detect isotope peaks
param.help: A expected m/z range is computed from the isotopes of the assumed elements. If enabled, this ignores 'mz_scoring_13C'

param.name: elements
param.label: Elements assumes to be present in the sample (this influences isotope detection)

param.name: force
param.label: Overrides tool-specific checks

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

data.name: out_chrom
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_chrom
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_chrom_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Assembles metabolite features from centroided (LC-)MS data using the mass trace approach.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/release/2.6.0/html/TOPP_FeatureFinderMetabo.html
